CRD_SpellTeaching.synopsis: In this scene, Gale is conjuring an image of Mystra over the palm of his hand, staring at the goddess he’s love with, but who abandoned him. When the player approaches, he dispels the image and he feels embarrassed to have been caught doing what he was doing. The conversation turns to his passion for magic however, and he invites the player to try to cast a spell with him together. The player can do so by passing through various stages of spell casting, and when successful, this can lead to a first player-initiated romantic moment with Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale holds out his arm. Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra. He's looking at the figure intensely.

CRD_SpellTeaching_35.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_35.text: Oh! My, you startled me. I... I was miles away.
CRD_SpellTeaching_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Startled, he dispells it.NodeContext: Gale is looking at a miniature magical projection of Mystra he's created in his hand in his hand. Startled, he dispells it.

CRD_SpellTeaching_38.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_38.text: Of course, of course. I was just... practising an incantation.

CRD_SpellTeaching_115.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_115.text: There's more to it than that. The figure I saw: she means something to you.

CRD_SpellTeaching_58.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_58.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching_185.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_185.text: I can't quite describe it, the need I sometimes feel to see her - to draw the filaments of fantasy into existence.

CRD_SpellTeaching_54.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_54.text: No sculpture or painting could ever do her justice, only the fabric that she herself is and embodies:

CRD_SpellTeaching_26.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_26.text: Mystra is all magic. And as far as I'm concerned, she is all creation.

CRD_SpellTeaching_117.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_117.text: I didn't realise the depth of your devotion.

CRD_SpellTeaching_81.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_81.text: Sounding more of a poet than a wizard there, Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching_216.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_216.text: It's a kind of love after all.

CRD_SpellTeaching_158.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_158.text: I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.

CRD_SpellTeaching_78.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_78.text: I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.

CRD_SpellTeaching_20.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_20.text: I wouldn't go quite that far myself.

CRD_SpellTeaching_83.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_83.text: No, but you do understand, don't you?

CRD_SpellTeaching_19.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_19.text: Magic is... my life. I've been in touch with the Weave for as long as I can remember. There's nothing like it.

CRD_SpellTeaching_165.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_165.text: It's like music, poetry, physical beauty all rolled into one and given expression through the senses.

CRD_SpellTeaching_178.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_178.text: Would you like to experience this?

CRD_SpellTeaching_116.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_116.text: Mystra normally answers me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.

CRD_SpellTeaching_111.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale walks around behind the player (as though teaching them to fly a kite) and makes a delicate gesture with both hands.

CRD_SpellTeaching_203.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player imitates the gesture. There’s a first visual effect. Some sparks of magic start to appear around the player and Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching_209.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_209.text: *A familiar feeling - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_25.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_25.text: Imitate the gesture with a flourish.

CRD_SpellTeaching_180.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_180.text: *You feel something strange - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_92.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_92.text: Excellent. Now repeat after me: Ah-Thran Mystra-Ryl Kantrach-Ao.
CRD_SpellTeaching_92.context: NodeContext: The line can be read just like the words appear, but with some mystical gravitas in the pronunciation. I picture this spoken the way Morgana speaks the Charm of Making in the following clip from Excalibur: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttq_4FwvLJo&gl=BE (First result when searching for “excalibur charm of making” on youtube.)

CRD_SpellTeaching_144.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_144.text: An easy incantation. Simply repeat after Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching_170.context: CinematicNodeContext: The visual effect intensifies. There’s the start of a glow, of a rush of beautiful magic.

CRD_SpellTeaching_161.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_161.text: *Ah, yes: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_166.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_166.text: You sense power in these words. Speak them deliberately.

CRD_SpellTeaching_31.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_31.text: *Suddenly: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_187.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_187.text: Very good. Now I want you to picture in your mind the concept of harmony. As true as you can.

CRD_SpellTeaching_177.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_177.text: Recede into the calm centre of your mind, just like you were taught at the academy.

CRD_SpellTeaching_192.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_192.text: Sink deep into your magic. It is who you are. It is home.

CRD_SpellTeaching_39.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_39.text: Harmony comes easily to you. Allow it to wash over your mind and magic.

CRD_SpellTeaching_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching_103.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_103.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the unmistakable presence of Mystra, the Lady of Mysteries.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_202.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_202.text: *There's something like the anticipation of a kiss, then the pleasure of being cloaked in peace.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_131.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_131.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of Mystra's hand.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_60.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_60.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of her hand.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_55.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_55.text: Look at that. We're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

CRD_SpellTeaching_135.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_135.text: You did it. You're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

CRD_SpellTeaching_183.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_183.text: The same as it always does.

CRD_SpellTeaching_13.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_13.text: You're hard to please, aren't you?

CRD_SpellTeaching_11.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_11.text: *The Weave connects you. The moment feels intimate.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_146.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_146.text: Hold on to the moment. It's a good night for intimacy.

CRD_SpellTeaching_14.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_14.text: *You realise the Weave is making you one. You have but to imagine your desire, and Gale will know it.*
CRD_SpellTeaching_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magic glow is at its peak. It makes the player and Gale look like the only people in the world, safe in their own miniature dimension.

CRD_SpellTeaching_17.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_17.text: *You perceive quick-fire gusts of embarrassment, trepidation, and finally... elation.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_210.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_210.text: Sorry, I wasn't expecting... But it is a pleasant image to be sure!

CRD_SpellTeaching_155.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_155.text: Most pleasant, in fact. Most welcome.

CRD_SpellTeaching_21.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_21.text: *The Weave evaporates, and as it does so, you realise the night feels suddenly cold and lonesome.*
CRD_SpellTeaching_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: All that beautiful magic slips away, and as it does, the player and Gale find themselves in the here and now again.

CRD_SpellTeaching_82.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_82.text: There it goes. How easily things slip away from us, no matter how hard they were in the obtaining.
CRD_SpellTeaching_82.context: NodeContext: The weave disappears – he says this with a passionate melancholy.

CRD_SpellTeaching_37.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_37.text: Good night. I enjoyed sharing a moment of magic with you.

CRD_SpellTeaching_34.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_34.text: Picture kicking him in the gut.

CRD_SpellTeaching_32.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_32.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured hitting him in the stomach, which he does not quite appreciate.

CRD_SpellTeaching_217.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_217.text: There it goes. I suppose a blow to the stomach upsets the Weave as much as it would me.

CRD_SpellTeaching_86.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_86.text: I'm going to bed. Perhaps this was all a mistake.

CRD_SpellTeaching_156.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_156.text: Picture his severed head on a spike.

CRD_SpellTeaching_191.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_191.text: Good gods, what on earth makes you picture that?
CRD_SpellTeaching_191.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured Gale’s head on a spike. He is surprised, hurt, angry and disgusted all at once.

CRD_SpellTeaching_66.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_66.text: Picture nothing. This is a bad idea.

CRD_SpellTeaching_99.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_99.text: This feels too intimate. It's time to let slip the Weave.

CRD_SpellTeaching_15.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_15.text: It's different, but I can definitely feel Mystra's presence.

CRD_SpellTeaching_195.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_195.text: Quite so. The Weave is a sensitive conduit.

CRD_SpellTeaching_212.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_212.text: It's different, but I can definitely feel a familiar kind of presence.

CRD_SpellTeaching_89.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_89.text: It feels like a good time to call it a night.

CRD_SpellTeaching_85.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_85.text: Picture the perfect darkness - to be in the womb of Shar.

CRD_SpellTeaching_173.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching_173.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the presence of a woman, the woman who hovered over Gale's palm.*

CRD_SpellTeaching_36.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_36.text: Recall a memory of early youth, a happy family moment.

CRD_SpellTeaching_189.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_189.text: Picture a place of utter peace, away from all harm and the mayhem of civilisation.

CRD_SpellTeaching_136.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_136.text: Think of the here and now: this unexpected moment of learning.

CRD_SpellTeaching_30.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_30.text: Try to hum a familiar tune.

CRD_SpellTeaching_154.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_154.text: That's too abstract for my tastes. Let's just forget about it, shall we?

CRD_SpellTeaching_130.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_130.text: I think it's a mistake to give up on the brink of success, but I cannot force your hand.

CRD_SpellTeaching_184.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_184.text: Repeat the words, bold and proud.

CRD_SpellTeaching_68.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_68.text: Repeat the words, slowly, but carefully.

CRD_SpellTeaching_172.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_172.text: Belt the words with a little flourish on 'Ao'.

CRD_SpellTeaching_152.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_152.text: Actually, I dislike tongue twisters. Let's just call it a night.

CRD_SpellTeaching_67.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_67.text: Not quite. But this is the easy part. Shall we try again?

CRD_SpellTeaching_105.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_105.text: No, I'm sorry, but it looks like magic's not on the cards tonight. Perhaps I'm not quite the teacher I fancy myself to be.
CRD_SpellTeaching_105.context: NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

CRD_SpellTeaching_101.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_101.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. As I'm sure you're aware.

CRD_SpellTeaching_122.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_122.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. Coy to a tee.

CRD_SpellTeaching_201.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_201.text: No, thanks. Not my cup of tea, clearly.

CRD_SpellTeaching_215.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_215.text: I think it's a mistake to give up so easily, but I cannot force your hand.

CRD_SpellTeaching_200.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_200.text: Imitate the gesture quickly and decisively.

CRD_SpellTeaching_125.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_125.text: Imitate the gesture slowly and as precisely as you can.

CRD_SpellTeaching_18.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_18.text: Actually, never mind. Magic is just not for me.

CRD_SpellTeaching_45.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_45.text: I think it's a mistake to hold that conviction, but I cannot force your hand.

CRD_SpellTeaching_129.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_129.text: Magic normally comes to me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.

CRD_SpellTeaching_75.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_75.text: No, I have no interest in such magic.

CRD_SpellTeaching_74.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_74.text: Disinterest is such a disheartening condition.

CRD_SpellTeaching_51.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_51.text: Always a pity when opportunities slip us by.

CRD_SpellTeaching_123.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_123.text: Is it the same for you?

CRD_SpellTeaching_94.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_94.text: Perhaps we can share the experience by reaching into the Weave together.

CRD_SpellTeaching_175.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_175.text: It's getting late. Perhaps another time.

CRD_SpellTeaching_196.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_196.text: It's different for me. Not quite so intense.

CRD_SpellTeaching_52.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_52.text: You wouldn't say that if you felt what I feel.

CRD_SpellTeaching_207.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_207.text: Perhaps I can show you what I mean by reaching into the Weave together.

CRD_SpellTeaching_97.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_97.text: Magic is music, poetry, and beauty. Though I suspect you and I perform it differently.

CRD_SpellTeaching_8.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_8.text: Magic is like music. But while you need it written down, I can play by ear.

CRD_SpellTeaching_162.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_162.text: Fair enough - though in the end we're still playing the same composition.

CRD_SpellTeaching_179.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_179.text: My magic is both ancient and raw. Sometimes even volatile.

CRD_SpellTeaching_77.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_77.text: Yes - as raw and ancient as the veins of Bahamut.

CRD_SpellTeaching_163.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_163.text: Still, it is magic in its purest, most essential rapture that I'm trying to impart.

CRD_SpellTeaching_71.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_71.text: It's less 'music and poetry', and more 'I hope I don't blow up'.

CRD_SpellTeaching_150.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_150.text: Believe it or not, I can relate.
CRD_SpellTeaching_150.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

CRD_SpellTeaching_0.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_0.text: That's just a lot of delusion speaking.

CRD_SpellTeaching_171.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_171.text: How narrow-minded. Magic goes far, far beyond Mystra.

CRD_SpellTeaching_182.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_182.text: Pish posh. One might as well deny one's mother's womb as the cradle of life.

CRD_SpellTeaching_205.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_205.text: You read too much into it. I was merely indulging in my passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching_143.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_143.text: I do - because it's through practice that I seek to perfect. To augment.

CRD_SpellTeaching_148.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_148.text: I'll leave you to it then. Good night.

CRD_SpellTeaching_24.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_24.context: NodeContext: Distracted. Still miles away in his head.

CRD_SpellTeaching_100.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_100.text: The figure you conjured: who is she? Someone you miss?

CRD_SpellTeaching_169.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_169.text: No, no. She's no one, really. I was just... practising an incantation.

CRD_SpellTeaching_47.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_47.text: You don't have that look on your face when you're looking at 'no one'.

CRD_SpellTeaching_119.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_119.text: What can I say? She's... She's Mystra.
CRD_SpellTeaching_119.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching_124.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_124.text: Care to tell me why you were conjuring an image of Mystra?

CRD_SpellTeaching_109.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_109.text: I know that look. You were praying to your goddess, weren't you?

CRD_SpellTeaching_96.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_96.text: Not praying. Not quite. I was just... practising an incantation.
CRD_SpellTeaching_96.context: NodeContext: He was recalling Mystra as a lover, but doesn't say that out loud.

CRD_SpellTeaching_2.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_2.text: No, there's more to it than that. I know devotion when I see it.

CRD_SpellTeaching_137.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_137.text: I'm no cleric, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

CRD_SpellTeaching_42.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching_42.text: I'm no paladin, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

CRD_SpellTeaching_118.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_118.text: Just go to sleep, why don't you. We have a long day ahead of us.

CRD_SpellTeaching_108.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_108.text: That's Mystra - the Mother of All Magic herself.

CRD_SpellTeaching_214.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_214.text: Cut that out. The light could attract enemies.

CRD_SpellTeaching_120.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching_120.text: That's the deity you wizards adore - Mystra, right?
